activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9080
activity.text: > **Test Report** > > **Functionality Bug** * [x] When you search for a username, the input field disappears. It only reappears after clearing the badge. Please revert this to the original behavior where the search field remains visible at all times. * [x] Similar issue noticeable for advanced filter as well * [x] Disable the "Add Facility" button for non-admin users on their own pages. * [x] Allow non-admin users to unlink their home facility and any facility in their access. * [x] The avatar on the user profile page and the profile icon are different. Please make them consistent. * [x] Reset the component's state after the password has been successfully changed. > **Question For Clarity** > * [ ] Only the account owner should be able to edit their own user information. However, with your current PR, an admin can edit other users' profiles. Is this the intended behavior? Yep, that's the intention. > * [ ] The new profile view details page and the personal profile page display nearly identical data. Could we consider combining them into a single page for simplicity and consistency? [Discuss with the core team]. Yep, we are merging those (removing current profile page), I was waiting on it since there was an intern PR open updating elements in Profile page. We can open an issue that interns can take up once this is merged * [x] Ensure the first column remains fixed in the mobile view for the user list. This will improve accessibility and ease of navigation. > * [ ] Add a "Last Modified" column in the user view page to display the date and time when the profile was last updated. Additionally, consider implementing an alert system to notify users to reverify their profile details after a period of 6 months or 1 year. This will help ensure that user information remains up-to-date. [Discussion required with core team before proceeding] 🤔 Yea could do for enhancement. Here are the tests passing locally: Details on the error (screenshot below). I sometimes encounter this when testing after resetting the db; bypass it by manually logging in the cypress window. ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a897b218-2cbd-48cd-b59a-f7a687029d19)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8812
activity.text: So we do need to make an extra change, consider the following scenario: - There are two locations (one with monitors with patients, one for monitors without). - When checkbox is unchecked, only one option shows up ("Dummy Locations"), which results in Filter by Location being disabled (as per the issue #8162). Now, consider following behavior. (1) User selects "Include monitors without patients" (2) Filters for location (which is only available under monitors without patients) (3) User unchecks monitors without patients At present, the filter form selection stays the same (resulting in No vitals screen which is not accurate), so we need to reset the filter whenever user marks/unmarks the checkbox. @rithviknishad I'm wondering if there's a way to do that without touching LocationSelect?

activity.text: > [@Jacobjeevan](https://github.com/Jacobjeevan) i think mark area looks better. > > Let's retain the bar graph option as well? > > Also could you add (IV/NIV/O2) also against the ventilator mode/oxygen modality mentioned? @aparnacoronasafe Sure, we can add those. We can keep the bar graphs, however there's some inconsistency in how it depicts the data for markArea🤔 For example: In the line chart, NP starts at 2:45PM (which is correct), but switching to bar chart, NP shows up later (I've highlighted 2:45PM on the bar chart below). Not only that, but the distinctions between NP/SFM/HFNC isn't as clear. activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8633
activity.text: For preventing the requests, we can add a hostname check for this scenario (cameraAsset.hostname corresponds to the ip address field). For (2), the error notification is coming from fireRequest (getStreamToken, calling operateAsset): But for this api call, backend is sending a detail object as data. On a side note, I was testing with a random IP address (expecting a 500 response), however that doesn't trigger further API calls as error.response is not being returned in fireRequest. Should we not change that? Resp is undefined so it won't called onError function.

activity.text: Remove tooltip after Cover Image Load

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8480
activity.text:
> Hey, could you push the current changes?

Done 👍

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8480
activity.text:
> Did you try passing a `key` prop to the img. component?

Never mind, I cleared my browser cache/restarted the dev server and it's working (persists across page reload). Only other issue is the change not reflecting on FacilityCard (if the user navigates thru back button or breadcrumb menu instead of reloading).

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8480
activity.text: > I don't see any type errors in `Force-Revalidate: random number as string` method. > > Numbers can't be set as header value. However, number as strings can be. > Ah ok, thanks! Wouldn't this require `Vary: Forced-Revalidate` on S3? Anyways, I tried with `Forced-Revalidate: 1`. But, I'm getting the same result as (2) in my reply above; new image is pulled by the fetch req in the network tab/dev tools, but only reflected on screen if I append a timestamp to the url. Cache doesn't seem to be updated as the change doesn't persist across page reload.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8480
activity.text: > No, you just need to simply send a fetch request to the signed URL of the image with that vary header, so that browser would invalidate it's cache. Therefore leading to the image component to render the new image as the new image is fetched instead of the old cached one. > > Nothing to do with calling any APIs. (1) Couldn't use the fetch + vary method as the HeadersInit type doesn't support it > Type '{ "Forced-Revalidate": number; }' is not assignable to type 'HeadersInit | undefined'. (2) Tried fetch + cache:reload instead. Checking the network tab, it does pull the new version of the image, however I had to append timestamp to have it reflect on page (I tried changing image src directly using getElementById, but that didn't reflect on screen). fetchImage is called on save of the Edit Cover Image Modal/Popup. It doesn't seem to update the cache though, since the change doesn't persist across page reload. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1077041/refresh-image-with-a-new-one-at-the-same-url/22429796#22429796 mentions few other solutions, including just using timestamp on img src directly, however that would mean storing multiple copies of the same image on cache.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8480
activity.text:
> you'll have to use fetch directly to achieve this since the image url is not a defined api route right? useQuery/request requires an API route to be defined, and the image url is not an API route.

@rithviknishad Oh, I meant moving out the facilityData useQuery to a fetch req (since cover image url is part of that object). Hmm, as for fetching the image url directly, that would require modifications on the backend, right?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8480
activity.text: @rithviknishad Hmm, since useQuery doesn't support a header parameter, I'd either need to replace it with a fetch outside or modify RequestOptions interface and request function to support header property (preferring the former since it touches less code). Does that sound right, or is there an alternative option?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8489
activity.text: Converting back to draft as I just saw the comment about cache invalidation https://github.com/ohcnetwork/care_fe/issues/8480#issuecomment-2330713632

Alternatively, I have been able to prefetch results using useQuery in UserAutocompleteFormField, although I'm unsure on how to attach that to options and trigger the dropdown.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7914
activity.text:

I've been able to use useQuery to prefetch the data, however I haven't had much success in displaying the results as a dropdown (trying to tie to onClick event in Autocomplete component). Any pointers on how to achieve that?

Alternatively I could use the prefetched data and just disable the component and display placeholder text, as you had originally envisioned (and remove the notifications as well).
